I didn't want to risk any changes to robots handling in the final days 
leading to release 1.14.0, but have since implemented support for the 
'Crawl-Delay' and 'Allow' robots.txt directives in the heritrix1 codebase.

A new setting on the frontier, 'respect-crawl-delay', default value 
true, will make a 'Crawl-Delay' value found that applies to the 
crawler's User-Agent an absolute floor for delays between request. (EG, 
if you have a 'max-delay-ms' of 10000ms, then encounter a Crawl-Delay of 
20 seconds, the 20 seconds wins out.)

The feature has received cursory testing.

The first build in which it appears is #245 from the CruiseControl auto 
builds:

http://builds.archive.org:8080/cruisecontrol/buildresults/HEAD-heritrix

Support for 'Allow' and 'Crawl-Delay' will be ported to the heritrix2 
codebase shortly.

- Gordon @ IA

>> honoring the "crawl-delay" parameter. Is this still a planned feature?
>>
